lead_paragraph: One of the keys to the Phillies’ late surge to the National League East championship last season was their ability to fill holes with support players when injuries cropped up. One of those players, outfielder Jayson Werth, is at it again for the Phillies, who are two games out of first despite losing Jimmy Rollins, the N.L.’s reigning most valuable player, and Shane Victorino, their starting center fielder.
